intro: Neurocalyx borneensis var. dulitensis, commonly known as the Bornean neurocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences that resemble a crown. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky outcrops, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and often have a waxy surface to reduce water loss. The flowers are small, fragrant, and attract pollinators such as bees and moths.
